palantir_competitive.headline: üö® PALANTIR EXPANDING AGGRESSIVELY - Q4 Revenue $1.41B, Government Contracts Driving 2026 Growth
key_insights: Revenue $1.41B exceeded estimates - anticipates big jump in 2026 from gov contracts
UK Ministry of Defence new enterprise agreement (tactical/operational decision making)
DHS contract ongoing ($139.3M for investigative case management)
CEO publicly defending surveillance tech - indicates political headwinds
sos_implications: Palantir focusing on surveillance/defense - humanitarian gap remains
Their complexity is a weakness - SOS can position as simpler, purpose-built
Government contracts show budget exists for coordination tech
Window before they pivot to disaster space still open

fema_funding_landscape.headline: üí∞ $2.2B+ in FEMA Disaster Relief Released This Week - Budget Exists
key_insights: $2.2B distributed across 25 states - largest portion to NC for Helene
Technology Modernization Fund reauthorized through FY2026
State and Local Cyber Grant Program extended
$11M expedited to TN, MS, LA for emergency response
Helene still driving funding - SOS has direct Helene connection
sos_implications: Massive funding flowing - proves budget for tech exists
Helene connection is compelling narrative for grants
States receiving funds need coordination tools

fema_workforce_risk.headline: ‚ö†Ô∏è FEMA Workforce Cuts Planned - Creates Private Tech Opportunity
key_insights: DHS planning CORE and surge staffing cuts for 2026
Court blocked 'arbitrary' grant changes - uncertainty remains
Private tech companies stepping in to support local officials
$17B in aid held up by extra scrutiny (Kristi Noem review)
sos_implications: Workforce cuts = need for tech force multipliers
Chaos in federal response = opportunity for alternatives
Position SOS as reducing dependency on federal staffing

reforge_competitive.headline: üìä Enterpret vs Dovetail - Market Positioning Intel
key_insights: Enterpret: $25.1M total funding across 2 rounds - well capitalized
Dovetail: Only $763K funding but strong brand in UX research
Both positioned as 'AI feedback analytics' - commoditizing
Market seeing flood of AI survey/feedback tools
reforge_implications: Enterpret 7x mentions in Reforge calls - they're the enemy
Dovetail weaker financially - less competitive threat
AI commoditization = need to differentiate on methodology
Reforge's 'Product Debt' positioning unique vs these tools

action_items.action: Target NC emergency management - largest Helene funding recipient
Position against Palantir complexity in grant applications
Research Technology Modernization Fund application process
Use 'Product Debt' positioning more - 100% resonance, only 29% usage
